HOME.TITLE: Home
HOME.INTRO_SUBTITLE: Where music creates connection, with purpose and attention.

TEXT.CONCEPT:
Picollect is a cultural movement that connects music and celebration to create connection with clear purpose.

Born in a city that moves fast, we create conscious spaces where mental health is openly accepted as a human reality, not as a trend or campaign.

Through music-based experiences, we promote presence, community and shared energy, making celebration something meaningful.

Picollect redefines how we celebrate.
With purpose. With people. With attention.
TEXT.MISSION:
Our mission is to create connection through meaningful celebration.

We develop music-based experiences that promote presence, openness and honest connection.

Mental health is at the core of everything we do, through visibility, concrete actions and long-term commitment.
TEXT.VISION:
We envision a culture where celebration creates impact.

Where events are not defined by their size, but by what they trigger.

Where music creates consciousness, community creates cohesion, and purpose becomes part of nightlife.

Our vision is to develop Picollect as a platform that connects artists, communities and mental health, in Luxembourg and beyond.
TEXT.MANIFIESTO:
We believe that celebration is a responsibility.
We believe that music is a universal language.

We believe that mental health deserves care, access and visibility, and that joy and consciousness can coexist.

Picollect is not just something you participate in.
It's something you stand for.

TEXT.CELEBRATE: We celebrate every achievement, large or small, as a community.
TEXT.AWARENESS: We promote awareness and learning for continuous growth.
TEXT.COMMUNITY: Our community is open, inclusive, and supportive.
TEXT.IMPACT: We strive to make a positive impact in everything we do.

POINT_1.TITLE: Mental Health
POINT_1.DESCRIPTION: Emotional well-being is at the center of celebration. We create safe and open spaces where mental health is recognized, respected and supported as a shared responsibility.

POINT_2.TITLE: Celebrate
POINT_2.DESCRIPTION: Music, movement and shared energy, designed to be vibrant, present and deeply human.

POINT_3.TITLE: Community
POINT_3.DESCRIPTION: Built with people, not for masses. Everyone plays a role, and cohesion comes before size.

POINT_4.TITLE: Impact
POINT_4.DESCRIPTION:
We turn celebration into action. At least 10% of our net profits support local NGOs in the mental health sector.

Through the 3.14 Program, each event provides free access to therapy. Three people receive one year of support, and fourteen people receive one month of therapy.

In total, nearly 200 hours of care are offered.

COMINGSOON.TITLE: Coming Soon
COMINGSOON.DESCRIPTION: This section will be available soon.

CONTACT.TITLE: Participate
CONTACT.SUCCESS_MESSAGE: Thank you for subscribing! We'll keep you updated.

COOKIES.TITLE: Cookies Policy
COOKIES.INTRO: At Picollect, we use cookies and similar technologies to improve your experience on our website. This policy explains what cookies are, how we use them, and your choices regarding them.
COOKIES.WHAT_ARE_TEXT: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your device when you visit a website. They help the website remember your actions and preferences over a period of time, so you don't have to re-enter them whenever you come back to the site or browse from one page to another.
COOKIES.INFO_COLLECTED_TEXT:
We use cookies to collect information about how you use our website, including:
  • Pages you visit
  • Time spent on each page
  • Links you click
  • Your device and browser type
  • Your IP address and location
COOKIES.PERSONAL_DATA_TEXT: Some cookies may collect personal data such as your IP address or device identifier. We treat this data in accordance with our Privacy Policy and applicable data protection laws.
COOKIES.THIRD_PARTY_DESC: We may use third-party services that set cookies on your device. These include:
COOKIES.THIRD_PARTY_INFO: Google Analytics - for website analytics and performance measurement
COOKIES.THIRD_PARTY_MORE: These third parties have their own privacy policies governing the use of your information.
COOKIES.THIRD_PARTY_SHARING_TEXT: Information collected through cookies may be shared with third-party service providers who help us operate our website and analyze how it is used. These providers are contractually bound to keep your information confidential and use it only for the purposes we specify.
COOKIES.DISABLE_DESC:
Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings. You can:
  • View what cookies are stored on your device
  • Delete cookies
  • Block some or all cookies
  • Be notified when cookies are being set

Please note that disabling cookies may affect the functionality of our website.

To learn how to manage cookies on popular browsers, visit:

  • Chrome: Cookie settings
  • Firefox: Cookie settings
  • Safari: Cookie settings
COOKIES.FOOTER: If you have any questions about our use of cookies, please contact us at contact@picollect.lu

PRIVACY.TITLE: Privacy Policy
PRIVACY.INTRO: This privacy notice for Picollect ('we', 'us', or 'our'), describes how and why we might collect, store, use, and/or share ('process') your information when you use our services ('Services'), such as when you visit our website at https://picollect.lu, or any website of ours that links to this privacy notice.
PRIVACY.SUMMARY_INTRO: This summary provides key points from our privacy notice, but you can find out more details about any of these topics by clicking the link following each key point or by using our table of contents below to find the section you are looking for.
PRIVACY.Q1: What personal information do we process?
PRIVACY.A1: When you visit, use, or navigate our Services, we may process personal information depending on how you interact with us and the Services, the choices you make, and the products and features you use.
PRIVACY.Q2: Do we process any sensitive personal information?
PRIVACY.A2: We do not process sensitive personal information.
PRIVACY.Q3: Do we receive any information from third parties?
PRIVACY.A3: We do not receive any information from third parties.
PRIVACY.Q4: How do we process your information?
PRIVACY.A4: We process your information to provide, improve, and administer our Services, communicate with you, for security and fraud prevention, and to comply with law. We may also process your information for other purposes with your consent.
PRIVACY.Q5: In what situations and with which parties do we share personal information?
PRIVACY.A5: We may share information in specific situations and with specific third parties.
PRIVACY.Q6: How do we keep your information safe?
PRIVACY.A6: We have organizational and technical processes and procedures in place to protect your personal information. However, no electronic transmission over the internet or information storage technology can be guaranteed to be 100% secure.
PRIVACY.A7: Depending on where you are located geographically, the applicable privacy law may mean you have certain rights regarding your personal information.
PRIVACY.TOC_2: How do we process your information?
PRIVACY.TOC_3: What legal bases do we rely on to process your personal information?
PRIVACY.TOC_4: When and with whom do we share your personal information?
PRIVACY.TOC_5: Do we use cookies and other tracking technologies?
PRIVACY.TOC_6: How long do we keep your information?
PRIVACY.TOC_7: How do we keep your information safe?
PRIVACY.TOC_8: Do we collect information from minors?
PRIVACY.TOC_11: Do we make updates to this notice?
PRIVACY.TOC_12: How can you contact us about this notice?
PRIVACY.TOC_13: How can you review, update, or delete the data we collect from you?
PRIVACY.COLLECT_INTRO: In Short: We collect personal information that you provide to us.
PRIVACY.COLLECT_PERSONAL: We collect personal information that you voluntarily provide to us when you express an interest in obtaining information about us or our products and Services, when you participate in activities on the Services, or otherwise when you contact us.
PRIVACY.COLLECT_NAMES: Names and Contact Data. We collect your first and last names, email address, postal address, phone number, and other similar contact data.
PRIVACY.COLLECT_CONTACT: Contact Preferences. We collect information about your preferences for receiving communications from us and your preferred method of contact.
PRIVACY.COLLECT_SENSITIVE: Sensitive Information. We do not process sensitive information.
PRIVACY.COLLECT_PROVIDED: All personal information that you provide to us must be true, complete, and accurate, and you must notify us of any changes to such personal information.
PRIVACY.PROCESS_INTRO:
In Short: We process your information to provide, improve, and administer our Services, communicate with you, for security and fraud prevention, and to comply with law. We may also process your information for other purposes with your consent.

We process your personal information for a variety of reasons, depending on how you interact with our Services, including to save or protect an individual's vital interest.
PRIVACY.LEGAL_INTRO:
In Short: We only process your personal information when we believe it is necessary and we have a valid legal reason (i.e., legal basis) to do so under applicable law, like with your consent, to comply with laws, to provide you with services to enter into or fulfill our contractual obligations, to protect your rights, or to fulfill our legitimate business interests.

We may process your information if you have given us specific permission (i.e., express consent) to use your personal information for a specific purpose, or in situations where your permission can be inferred (i.e., implied consent).
PRIVACY.SHARE_INTRO:
In Short: We may share information in specific situations described in this section and/or with the following third parties.

We may need to share your personal information in the following situations:
  • Business Transfers. We may share or transfer your information in connection with, or during negotiations of, any merger, sale of company assets, financing, or acquisition of all or a portion of our business to another company.
PRIVACY.COOKIES_INTRO:
In Short: We may use cookies and other tracking technologies to collect and store your information.

We may use cookies and similar tracking technologies (like web beacons and pixels) to access or store information. Specific information about how we use such technologies and how you can refuse certain cookies is set out in our Cookie Policy.
PRIVACY.COOKIES_GOOGLE: We use Google Analytics to help us understand how our customers use the Site. You can read more about how Google uses your Personal Information here:
PRIVACY.RETAIN_INTRO:
In Short: We keep your information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this privacy notice unless otherwise required by law.

We will only keep your personal information for as long as it is necessary for the purposes set out in this privacy notice, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law (such as tax, accounting, or other legal requirements).
PRIVACY.SAFE_INTRO:
In Short: We aim to protect your personal information through a system of organizational and technical security measures.

We have implemented appropriate and reasonable technical and organizational security measures designed to protect the security of any personal information we process. However, despite our safeguards and efforts to secure your information, no electronic transmission over the Internet or information storage technology can be guaranteed to be 100% secure.
PRIVACY.MINORS_INTRO:
In Short: We do not knowingly collect data from or market to children under 18 years of age.

We do not knowingly solicit data from or market to children under 18 years of age. By using the Services, you represent that you are at least 18 or that you are the parent or guardian of such a minor and consent to such minor dependent's use of the Services.
PRIVACY.RIGHTS_INTRO:
In Short: Depending on your state of residence in the US or in some regions, such as the European Economic Area (EEA), United Kingdom (UK), and Switzerland, you have rights that allow you greater access to and control over your personal information. You may review, change, or terminate your account at any time.

In some regions (like the EEA, UK, and Switzerland), you have certain rights under applicable data protection laws. These may include the right (i) to request access and obtain a copy of your personal information, (ii) to request rectification or erasure; (iii) to restrict the processing of your personal information; (iv) if applicable, to data portability; and (v) not to be subject to automated decision-making.
PRIVACY.DNT_INTRO:
In Short: Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems and mobile applications include a Do-Not-Track ('DNT') feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected.

At this stage no uniform technology standard for recognizing and implementing DNT signals has been finalized. As such, we do not currently respond to DNT browser signals or any other mechanism that automatically communicates your choice not to be tracked online.
PRIVACY.UPDATES_INTRO:
In Short: Yes, we will update this notice as necessary to stay compliant with relevant laws.

We may update this privacy notice from time to time. The updated version will be indicated by an updated 'Revised' date and the updated version will be effective as soon as it is accessible. We encourage you to review this privacy notice frequently to be informed of how we are protecting your information.
PRIVACY.CONTACT_INTRO: If you have questions or comments about this notice, you may contact us by email at:
PRIVACY.REVIEW_INTRO: Based on the applicable laws of your country, you may have the right to request access to the personal information we collect from you, change that information, or delete it. To request to review, update, or delete your personal information, please contact us.
